item.title: Secret State of North Korea
item.description: Using undercover footage, FRONTLINE explores life under Kim Jong-un.

item.title: To Catch a Trader
item.description: Inside the dramatic, unprecedented hunt that uncovered vast insider trading at Wall Street hedge funds.

item.title: The Long Walk of Nelson Mandela
item.description: FRONTLINE profiles the most widely known and revered political leader in the world -- Nelson Mandela.

item.title: A Death in St. Augustine
item.description: What happens when the police are faced with domestic violence allegations within their own ranks?

item.title: Who Was Lee Harvey Oswald?
item.description: An investigative biography examining the life and enduring mysteries of the man who assassinated President Kennedy.

item.title: Hunting the Nightmare Bacteria
item.description: FRONTLINE investigates the rise of deadly drug-resistant bacteria.

item.title: League of Denial: The NFL's Concussion Crisis
item.description: FRONTLINE reveals the hidden story of the NFL and brain injuries.

item.title: Egypt in Crisis
item.description: FRONTLINE examines the rise and rapid fall of Egyptâ€™s Muslim Brotherhood.

item.title: Life and Death in Assisted Living
item.description: FRONTLINE and ProPublica investigate assisted living in America.

item.title: Two American Families
item.description: Bill Moyers chronicles two ordinary families -- one black, one white -- for two decades.

item.title: WikiSecrets
item.description: The inside story of Julian Assange, Bradley Manning and the biggest intelligence breach in U.S. history.

item.title: Rape in the Fields
item.description: Lowell Bergman investigates the hidden reality of rape on the job in America.

item.title: Outlawed in Pakistan
item.description: The story of a girl in Pakistan whose life is at risk for daring to allege rape.

item.title: Never Forget to Lie
item.description: Filmmaker Marian Marzynski explores his own wartime childhood and the experiences of other child survivors of the Holocaust.

item.title: The Retirement Gamble
item.description: Will your IRA or 401K accounts ensure a safe retirement?

item.title: Syria Behind the Lines
item.description: An unprecedented film documents the everyday life of both Syriaâ€™s rebels and its regime.

item.title: Kind Hearted Woman
item.description: The intimate story of a single mother desperately trying to heal following years of abuse.

item.title: Newtown Divided
item.description: In the aftermath of the Sandy Hook tragedy, FRONTLINE examines how the nation's gun debate is playing out in Newtown.

item.title: Raising Adam Lanza
item.description: In the wake of the mass killings at Sandy Hook, FRONTLINE looks for answers to the elusive question: who was Adam Lanza?

item.title: Cliffhanger
item.description: FRONTLINE investigates the inside history of how Washington has failed to solve the countryâ€™s problems of debt and deficit.

item.title: The Untouchables
item.description: FRONTLINE examines why no Wall St. execs have faced fraud charges for the financial crisis

item.title: Inside Obama's Presidency
item.description: FRONTLINE takes a probing look at the first four years of Barack Obama's presidency.

item.title: The Education of Michelle Rhee
item.description: FRONTLINE examines the legacy of one of America's most controversial school reformers.

item.title: Poor Kids
item.description: FRONTLINE explores what poverty means to children and to the countryâ€™s future.

item.title: The Suicide Plan
item.description: An unforgettable portrait takes viewers inside one of the most polarizing social issues of our time

item.title: Big Sky, Big Money
item.description: How has the Supreme Courtâ€™s Citizens United decision changed campaigns in America?

item.title: Climate of Doubt
item.description: Coming Oct 23, FRONTLINE explores the massive shift in public opinion on climate change.

item.title: The Choice 2012
item.description: A journey into the places, people and decisive moments that made the men who are competing for the presidency.

item.title: Dropout Nation
item.description: An unforgettable portrait of four students in crisis and the adults waging a daily, personal struggle to get them to graduation.

item.title: The Battle for Syria
item.description: FRONTLINE travels to Syria where rebel groups are taking on the forces of President Assad.

item.title: Alaska Gold
item.description: Inside a growing battle in Bristol Bay, Alaska, home to the last great wild sockeye salmon fisheryâ€“and enormous mineral deposits.

item.title: Fast Times at West Philly High
item.description: Students and teachers from West Philadelphia High School defy expectations as they design and build two super-hybrid cars.

item.title: Middle School Moment
item.description: How one Bronx school is using a novel form of data collection and analysis to predict and prevent dropouts before they happen.

item.title: ENDGAME: AIDS in Black America
item.description: A groundbreaking two-hour exploration of one of the country's most urgent, preventable health crises.

item.title: Dollars and Dentists
item.description: FRONTLINE and the Center for Public Integrity investigate the flaws in our dental system and nascent proposals to fix them.

item.title: Digital Nation
item.description: Is our 24/7 wired world causing us to lose as much as we've gained?

item.title: My Father, My Brother, and Me
item.description: Correspondent Dave Iverson's personal journey to understand Parkinson's, a disease which has taken such a toll on his family.

item.title: Al Qaeda In Yemen
item.description: Award-winning reporter Ghaith Abdul-Ahad travels deep into Yemen's radical heartland

item.title: Six Billion Dollar Bet
item.description: FRONTLINE investigates MF Global's massive bet on European debt that went sour.

item.title: Cell Tower Deaths
item.description: FRONTLINE and ProPublica investigate the causes of cell tower deaths.

item.title: Money, Power and Wall Street
item.description: In a special investigation, FRONTLINE goes inside the struggles to rescue and repair a shattered economy

item.title: The Real CSI
item.description: How reliable is the science behind forensics? FRONTLINE finds serious flaws in some of the best-known tools of forensic science.

item.title: Murdoch's Scandal
item.description: FRONTLINE tells the story of the struggle over the future of News Corporation, Rupert Murdoch's reputation and family's fortunes.

item.title: The Vaccine War
item.description: Examining the raging debate--risks v. benefits and parents' right to make choices about their child v. the needs of a community

item.title: Inside Japan's Nuclear Meltdown
item.description: An unprecedented account of the crisis inside the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear complex after the devastating earthquake and tsunami.

item.title: The Child Cases
item.description: What happens when a child dies under suspicious circumstances?

item.title: Educating Sergeant Pantzke
item.description: For-profit college promise veterans a high quality degree -- but do they deliver?

item.title: The Interrupters
item.description: An intimate journey across the violent landscape of our cities through the eyes of those fighting to sow peace and security.

item.title: Rules of Engagement
item.description: What happened that November day in Haditha, Iraq gets to the heart of the war U.S. troops are fighting.

item.title: Post Mortem
item.description: Inside America's death investigation system. WARNING: Don't die in the wrong state.

item.title: The Meth Epidemic
item.description: Why, and how, have we reached the point where the United States has 1.5 million meth users - and rising?

item.title: Nuclear Aftershocks
item.description: FRONTLINE examines the implications of the Fukushima accident for U.S. nuclear safety.

item.title: The Secret War
item.description: Inside the deepest front in America's war against Al Qaeda and the Taliban: Pakistan

item.title: Opium Brides
item.description: Najibullah Quraishi reports on the harrowing story of the collateral damage of the counter-narcotics effort in Afghanistan.

item.title: The Undertaking
item.description: A haunting portrait of the world of Lynch & Sons Funeral Directors, a family which has long cared for the dead - and the living.

item.title: From Jesus to Christ: The First Christians
item.description: The story of the life of Jesus and the epic rise of Christianity. Said one critic: " It's a revelation of what television can be."

item.title: The Madoff Affair
item.description: Inside the world's first global Ponzi scheme, and how he got away with it for so long...

item.title: Flying Cheap
item.description: Is the aviation system being stretched beyond its capacity to deliver service that is both cheap and safe?

item.title: A Perfect Terrorist
item.description: Investigating David Headleyâ€™s rise from heroin dealer and U.S. government informant to plotter of the 2008 Mumbai attacks.

item.title: Syria Undercover
item.description: A rare look at the uprising from inside Syria, plus a profile of the dictator who has held on longest amidst the Arab unrest

item.title: Death by Fire
item.description: Cameron Todd Willingham - executed for the arson murder of his three daughters. Could this case change the death penalty debate?

item.title: Lost in Detention
item.description: FRONTLINE and the Investigative Reporting Workshop investigate the Obama administration's get-tough immigration policy.

item.title: The Anthrax Files
item.description: FRONTLINE, ProPublica and McClatchy Newspapers investigate the country's most notorious act of bioterrorism

item.title: The Man Behind the Mosque
item.description: The inside story of the most controversial building in America.

item.title: An Optimist In Haiti
item.description: Adam Davidson returns to Haiti to meet a man with an unlikely plan to help turn around his countryâ€™s economy through tourism.

item.title: The Wounded Platoon
item.description: The men of Third Platoon, Charlie Company: What happened to them in Iraq ... and what happened when they came home.

item.title: Are We Safer?
item.description: Investigating the vast terrorist-industrial complex post 9/11 and its growing reach into the lives of ordinary Americans...

item.title: The Interrogator
item.description: An extended conversation with Ali Soufan, the FBI agent who was at the center of the 9/11 investigations

item.title: Faith and Doubt at Ground Zero
item.description: One year after 9/11 how did America grapple with its biggest and most difficult questions?

item.title: Top Secret America
item.description: FRONTLINE investigates the journey from 9/11 to the Marathon bombings & the secret history of America's battle against terrorism.

item.title: The Man Who Knew
item.description: John O'Neill, the FBI's expert on Al Qaeda warned of its threat. But his maverick style doomed his career.

item.title: Football High
item.description: High school football has never had a higher profile ... but is winning worth the risks?
